questions.question_text:
Which two components are included in Dynamics 365 Marketing? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Customer voice is added as complement...

Customer Service Hub - Is a D365 Cust. Service App & Enterprise Asset Management - should be from Field Service, thus the 2 left & correct answers are 
A - Customer Voice survey & D - Event management
'customer voice survey' and 'event management ' are also the two most important components in marketing

Selected Answer: AD
A and D
Correct, the answer are A & B

Correct => A & D
The customer service hub is an "app" like a "sales hub" 
& 
Enterprise Asset Management I think is part of Field Service 
But 100 % both service hub & asset management are not part of Marketing

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Marketing. The company uses a third-party app to send email surveys to prospects to better understand their business needs.
There is currently no link to prospect records and users report that the survey management process is manual and is difficult to manage.
You need to automate the survey process and streamline collection and analysis of responses.
What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: I believe the answers are B&C
Dynamics 365 Marketing has no survey function now, the function has been moved to Customer Voice.

Selected Answer: BC
B & C seems to be correct 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-voice/send-survey-flow

B and D for me: survey campaign can be create within customer voice: https://dynamics.microsoft.com/en-gb/customer-voice/survey-questionnaire/
Power automate is not required to send survey
A making no sense, Dyn MKT don't has survey, just Dyn Customer Voive.

Selected Answer: BC
BC for me

Selected Answer: BC
Dynamics 365 Marketing has no survey function now, the function has been moved to Customer Voice. Thus, B & C is making sense.

Selected Answer: BC
Dynamics 365 Marketing does not allow survey creation.

comments.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/marketing/surveys 
Watch this page, It actually is possible to make a survey in D365 marketing.
The page you provided actually has this: "If you want to create new surveys in Marketing, you should use Dynamics 365 Customer Voice." this is from July 2020 update
Not for now, the function has been switched to Customer Voice. So the answer should be B & C

choices.B: Use Customer Voice to collect and analyze survey results
choices.A: Create a survey in Dynamics 365 Marketing and create a campaign to send it to out and collect data
choices.E: Use Customer Voice to compile results from the existing third-party app
choices.C: Use Power Automate to automatically send Customer Voice surveys
choices.D: Create surveys in Dynamics 365 Marketing by using Questionnaire

questions.question_text:
You have a chart that displays a summary of accounts by industry.
You need a chart that groups the account data by city instead of by industry. You must be able to access the chart at a later date.
What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.C: Select the city field in the drill-down menu.

discussion.content: Correct - drill down will view only selected data, so it won't be complete. Expanding will only make chart look bigger, filtering the data won't change
